{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3485531,"name":"Cole Shumaker","username":"c.shu","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/c.shu/{size}/136963_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T13:32:42.858Z","cooked":"

This is our first year building a swerve drive so I’m looking for some input related to frame size effect on a swerve’s agility.

I’m assuming a perfectly square robot would perform better with swerve than a rectangular shape since all four corners would be equally spaced apart allowing for better “spinning” movements.

But how much of an impact does the length to width aspect ratio effect the swerve drive? If I go something like 24x36 (just throwing a random number out there) how much of an impact on performance will you see?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T13:32:42.858Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":26,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":157.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482267,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-and-frame-size","display_username":"Cole Shumaker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17731,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9237 - Lead Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-and-frame-size/482267/1","custom_user_title":"9237 - Lead Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3485536,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T13:37:27.614Z","cooked":"

There is no difference in spinning performance, at least code wise.

The larger the robot you have the slower it’s max spin speed is in theory (wheels traveling along a larger circumference). Square(ish) robots have an advantage rolling off of other robots bumpers vs very rectangular ones (shorter sides to get pinned).

Square robots are “easier” to program because all of the math is symmetrical (although this could cause headaches down the road)

Honestly one of the biggest things is making sure your drivebase is reasonably flat (all 4 wheels touching ground) and your weight is somewhat evenly loaded on all 4 wheels.

Finally there is the stability argument. Very rectangular (high aspect bots) ar going ti be a fair bit more tippy about that long axis. There are some things you can do to mitigate this.

Tldr: First time with swerve? Make a square.

Thanks for the information. What I’m picturing is that if all 4 corners turn 45 degrees and your robot isn’t square its going to cause some scrubbing of the wheels on the carpet.

The math accounts for this in modern libraries, if you are trying to spin in a circle the wheels drive tangential.

Skyehawk:

First time with swerve? Make a square.

I wouldn’t sweat a 28"x30" robot in the least, but yeah, don’t go for an 18"x36".

Our 2023 and 2025 robots are/will be 27x27, but 2024 was 23x27 for the actual swerve, bumped out to 30x27 for the under the bumper intake, so even something like that is fine.
